rule.Name: AvoidRedundancyInMethodNameRule
rule.problem: This method's name includes the type name of the first parameter. This usually makes an API more verbose and less future-proof than necessary.
rule.solution: Remove the type from the method name, move the method into the parameter's type, or create an extension method (if using C#).

rule.Name: AvoidRepetitiveCastsRule
rule.problem: The method seems to repeat the same cast operation multiple times.
rule.solution: Change the logic to ensure the (somewhat expensive) cast is done once.

rule.Name: AvoidUnsealedUninheritedInternalTypeRule
rule.problem: Due to performance issues, types which are not visible outside of the assembly and which have no derived types should be sealed.
rule.solution: You should seal this type, unless you plan to inherit from this type in the near-future.

rule.Name: AvoidUnusedParametersRule
rule.problem: The method contains one or more unused parameters.
rule.solution: You should remove or use the unused parameters.

target.Name: System.Void Example.Application.Program::Main(System.String[])
target.defect: Parameter 'args' of type 'System.String[]' is never used in the method.

rule.Name: CheckParametersNullityInVisibleMethodsRule
rule.problem: A visible method does not check its parameter(s) for null values.
rule.solution: Since the caller is unknown you should always verify all of your parameters to protect yourself.

rule.Name: ConsiderUsingStaticTypeRule
rule.problem: This type contains only static fields and methods and should be static.
rule.solution: Change this type into a static type to gain clarity and better error reporting.

rule.Name: ImplementEqualsTypeRule
rule.problem: Since this type overrides Equals(object) it is also a good candidate to provide a Equals method for it's own type.
rule.solution: Implement the suggested method or interface (2.0) to avoid casting and, for ValueType, boxing penalities.

rule.Name: MarkAssemblyWithCLSCompliantRule
rule.problem: This assembly is not decorated with the [CLSCompliant] attribute.
rule.solution: Add this attribute to ease the use (or non-use) of your assembly by CLS consumers.

rule.Name: ParameterNamesShouldMatchOverriddenMethodRule
rule.problem: This method overrides (or implements) an existing method but does not use the same parameter names as the original.
rule.solution: Keep parameter names consistent when overriding a class or implementing an interface.

target.Name: System.Boolean Example.Core.Money::Equals(System.Object)
target.defect: The name of parameter #1 (anObject) does not match the name of the parameter in the overriden method (obj).

target.Name: System.Boolean Example.Core.MoneyBag::Equals(System.Object)
target.defect: The name of parameter #1 (anObject) does not match the name of the parameter in the overriden method (obj).

rule.Name: ReviewInconsistentIdentityRule
rule.problem: The type does not manage identity consistently in its Equals, relational operator, CompareTo, GetHashCode, and Clone methods.
rule.solution: Equals, relational operator, CompareTo methods should use the same fields and getter properties. GetHashCode should use the same fields/properties or a strict subset of them. Clone should use the same fields/properties or a superset of them.

target.Name: Example.Core.Money
target.defect: GetHashCode uses fields and/or properties not used by the equality methods: fCurrency fAmount
